Convention Bureau on Jan. 23, 2020 PUNTA GORDA/ENGLEWOOD BEACH, Fla. (January 22, 2020) ‚Äì Punta Gorda/Englewood Beach Visitor & Convention Bureau was honored this week with two Adrian Awards, the largest and most prestigious global tourism marketing competition by Hospitality Sales and Marketing Association International (HSMAI), for its work to promote the county as Florida‚Äôs premier Gulf Coast destination. Competing against some of the world‚Äôs most iconic brands and destinations, Punta Gorda/Englewood Beach‚Äôs brand campaign, ‚Äú Outsiders Welcome ,‚Äù earned a bronze award and the destination‚Äôs Visitor Guide took home a silver award, among more than 1,100 submissions. The two promotional projects were judged by experts in the hospitality, travel, tourism and media industries, and showcased extraordinary success achieving their key marketing objectives to drive awareness for the destination. The Outsiders Welcome campaign promotes differentiating factors of Punta Gorda/Englewood Beach from competing Florida destinations, and emphasized the area‚Äôs wealth of extraordinary outside activities and gorgeous natural settings. With beautiful beaches and fun activities on and off the water, the destination went to market for the past few years with the tagline, ‚ÄúOur Best Side is Outside.‚Äù Punta Gorda/Englewood Beach‚Äôs engaging Visitor Guide, dynamically named ‚ÄúAdventure Journal,‚Äù was curated to inspire potential visitors to learn more about the destination and envision their ultimate vacation on Florida‚Äôs coveted Gulf Coast. ‚ÄúOur team is thrilled to be named among the top innovative tourism brands and destinations in the nation,‚Äù says Wendie Vestfall, Tourism Director at the Punta Gorda/Englewood Beach Visitor & Convention Bureau. ‚ÄúWe are extremely proud of our destination and feel privileged to have the support of our dedicated industry partners to share the experiential story of Punta Gorda/Englewood Beach.‚Äù For more information on Punta Gorda/Englewood Beach, visit PureFlorida.com. Engage with the destination on social media at @RealPureFlorida on Facebook, Instagram and Twitter. # # # ABOUT PUNTA GORDA/ENGLEWOOD BEACH Located on Florida‚Äôs coveted Southwest Gulf Coast, halfway between Tampa and Naples, Punta Gorda/Englewood Beach is a charming collection of coastal communities surrounding the state‚Äôs second largest harbor. Florida‚Äôs premier year-round eco-tourism destination, the area offers pristine, unspoiled beauty. A haven for outdoor enthusiasts, Punta Gorda/Englewood Beach showcases a variety of vibrant experiences.¬†From beaches to boating, hiking to harbor tours, fishing to nature discovery; to sun, shelling and fossilized sharks teeth, the destination celebrates the active traveler and lively local in search of relaxation and unlimited discovery.¬†Most notably known for its 830 miles of pristine¬†unparalleled¬†shoreline, including captivating river passages, a mangrove-edged aquatic preserve and more than a dozen miles of natural Gulf beaches, the Charlotte Harbor Gulf Island Coast includes the areas of Boca Grande, Don Pedro Island, El Jobean, Englewood-Cape Haze, Little Gasparilla Island, Manasota Key, Knight Island, Placida, Babcock Ranch, Port Charlotte and Punta Gorda.¬†To learn more about Punta Gorda/Englewood Beach, visit http://PureFlorida.com , call 1-800-652-6090 or engage with the destination on Instagram, Twitter and Facebook @RealPureFlorida. Punta Gorda/Englewood Beach Visitor & Convention Bureau on Nov. 10, 2020 PUNTA GORDA/ENGLEWOOD BEACH, Fla. (Nov. 10, 2020) ‚Äì Sean Walter has joined the Punta Gorda/Englewood Beach Visitor & Convention Bureau as Sales/Sports Business Development Director. He will work in retaining and bringing meetings and group business and sporting events to Charlotte County. Walter has an extensive background in tourism operations, sales, and marketing and began his career with the Walt Disney World Company. Most recently, he served as Sports Director and Senior Manager of the Bradenton Area Convention and Visitors Bureau where he oversaw leisure, group, and meetings sales; the Bradenton Area Film Commission; the Bradenton Area Sports Commission; the Bradenton Area Convention Center; and the Premier Sports Campus, a 23 field multi-purpose sports complex. His experience includes working with national and international governing bodies, collegiate and professional organizations, and youth associations for trainings and tournaments. ‚ÄúI am excited to be part of this team and look forward to marketing and selling all the wonderful assets Charlotte County has to offer visitors,‚Äù said Sean Walter, Sales/Sports Business Development Director for the Punta Gorda/Englewood Beach Visitor & Convention Bureau. The Punta Gorda/Englewood Beach VCB is the Tourism Department for Charlotte County Government. Its mission is to brand, market, and sell Charlotte County as Florida‚Äôs premier ecotourism, leisure, sports, and meeting and conference destination for the continual economic benefit of the community. Charlotte County collects a 5% tourist development tax on accommodation stays six months or less, in addition to the 7% sales tax. The first 3% is spent for tourism promotion and marketing while the fourth and fifth percent are used to fund debt services on the bond for renovations at the Charlotte Sports Park. Information on Punta Gorda/Englewood Beach is available at PureFlorida.com. For additional information, call 941-743-1900. ### Share Categories: Press Releases Author Punta Gorda/Englewood Beach Visitor & Convention Bureau Contact: Punta Gorda/Englewood Beach Visitor & Convention Bureau Tel: 941.743.1900 Email: media@pureflorida.com Subscribe to Our Quarterly Enews Visitor Information Center 1700 Tamiami Trail, Suite G-2, Port Charlotte, FL 33948 Phone: 941.743.1900 #bestsideoutside About Us Partners Media Contact Sitemap Privacy Policy Event Development Program ¬© 2025 Punta Gorda/Englewood Beach Visitor & Convention Bureau

Visitor & Convention Bureau on Dec. 19, 2023 Punta Gorda/Englewood Beach Welcomes Allegiant‚Äôs Sunseeker Resort The new-build resort officially opened December 15 Punta Gorda/Englewood Beach, FL ‚Äì The Punta Gorda/Englewood Beach Visitor & Convention Bureau (VCB) is thrilled to announce the official opening of Allegiant Travel Company's Sunseeker Resort Charlotte Harbor , marking a significant milestone in the region's hospitality, meetings, wellness and culinary landscape. The new-build property is the first with over 750 rooms to open in Southwest Florida in over thirteen years. Sunseeker Resort Charlotte Harbor Resort is expected to bring more visitation to the area, boosting an already impressive $1B of total economic impact to Punta Gorda/Englewood Beach generated from visitors in FY2023. The property is expected to employ over 1,200 hospitality workers in Southwest Florida, further contributing to the region's economic growth. The resort has a total of 785 guest rooms available for reservations, along with the following exciting key features: 20 diverse dining options and innovative beverage programs available to the public including a 25,000-square-foot food hall experience 60,000-square-feet of meeting and conference space: Two waterfront ballrooms available for meetings, groups or weddings Two expansive pools, including a 21,000-square-foot adults-only rooftop retreat. (The 117,000-square-foot ground-level pool experience is set to become the largest pool in Southwest Florida) Scenic harborside promenade with retail outlets State-of-the-art 7,100-square-foot fitness center and full-service spa An exclusive 18-hole golf course, Aileron Golf Club, available only to hotel guests Its prime waterfront location overlooks the stunning Charlotte Harbor, providing guests with breathtaking views and proximity to all that the area has to offer from world-class fishing to island-hopping. While Sunseeker Resort Charlotte Harbor provides an abundance of amenities and activities within its sprawling grounds, the Punta Gorda/Englewood Beach area compliments the resort experience with its distinct experiences. Guests are invited to make the most of their visit by exploring the local breathtaking beaches and parks, creating a well-rounded trip that blends a luxurious resort stay with the charm and allure of a peaceful and natural paradise. The resort's convenient location, just ten minutes from Punta Gorda Airport (PGD), ensures easy access for guests traveling to and from their flights. Sunseeker Resort Charlotte Harbor is situated at 5500 Sunseeker Way, Charlotte Harbor, FL 33980. For more information or to make reservations at Sunseeker Resort Charlotte Harbor, visit www.sunseekerresorts.com or call (833) 909-5700. Stay connected with the latest news and updates by following the hotel on Instagram @sunseekerresorts. To create an itinerary for your upcoming visit to Punta Gorda/Englewood Beach, please visit https://www.pureflorida.com/plan-your-visit/visitor-guide/ . ABOUT SUNSEEKER RESORT CHARLOTTE HARBOR Opening December 2023, Florida‚Äôs newest luxury resort located in Charlotte Harbor is the first resort property of Sunseeker Resorts, a wholly owned subsidiary of Allegiant Travel Company. Sunseeker Resort Charlotte Harbor occupies over 22 waterfront acres with 785 guestrooms, including 189 Signature SunsuitesTM. Set upon the Peace River and Florida Gulf Coast, this premier resort offers 20 original dining and bar concepts; including seven stand-alone restaurants and a multi-dining experience. Additional hotel amenities include a waterfront boardwalk, two unique rooftop and waterfront pool experiences, 60,000-square-feet of combined convention space, full-service spa and salon, a 7,100-square-foot state-of-the-art fitness center with four group exercise studios with specialty instructor lead classes, three retail and market shops, and an 18-hole championship level golf club exclusive to hotel guests only. The resort is conveniently located within a short drive of Punta Gorda, Fort Myers, Tampa, St. Petersburg-Clearwater, and Sarasota airports. For more information, visit www.SunseekerResorts.com . Follow us on Instagram: @Sunseekerresorts and like us on Facebook: @Sunseekerresorts. ABOUT PUNTA GORDA / ENGLEWOOD BEACH Punta Gorda/Englewood Beach is Florida‚Äôs best-kept secret of a charming natural paradise located on the idyllic Southwest Gulf Coast. This coastal community surrounding the state‚Äôs second-largest harbor sits conveniently between Tampa and Naples. Outdoor enthusiasts will find a haven of vibrant experiences in the sun-soaked oasis of the Southwest Florida islands, characterized by almost year-round sunshine and sub-tropical weather. Relaxation and discovery await in miles of waterways and inland exploration trails filled with unspoiled natural beauty. From beaches to boating, hiking to harbor tours, fishing to nature paths; to sun, shelling, and fossilized sharks‚Äô teeth, Punta Gorda/Englewood Beach immerses lively locals and active adventurers in a pure island experience. Most notably known for its 830 miles of pristine unparalleled shoreline, including captivating river passages, a mangrove-edged aquatic preserve, and more than a dozen miles of natural Gulf beaches, the Charlotte Harbor Gulf Island Coast includes the areas of Boca Grande, Don Pedro Island, Englewood-Cape Haze, Little Gasparilla Island, Manasota Key, Knight Island, Placida, Babcock Ranch, Port Charlotte, Charlotte Harbor and Punta Gorda. To learn more about Punta Gorda /Englewood Beach, visit PureFlorida.com , call 941.743.1900 or discover the destination on Instagram, Twitter and Facebook @RealPureFlorida. Beach Visitor & Convention Bureau on Jun. 01, 2020 PUNTA GORDA/ENGLEWOOD BEACH, Fla. (June 1, 2020) ‚Äì The Punta Gorda/Englewood Beach Visitor and Convention Bureau is pleased to announce the City of Punta Gorda has been nominated for the 2020 USA TODAY 10Best Readers‚Äô Choice Awards - Best Small Town Food Scene. Voting is open to the public online at https://www.10best.com/awards/travel/best-small-town-food-scene-2020/punta-gorda-florida/through Monday, June 29 at noon. The town that receives the most eligible votes will be designated as the 2020 Reader‚Äôs Choice Best Small Town Food Scene in the United States. ‚ÄúWhile Punta Gorda is perhaps best known for its beautiful location along Charlotte Harbor, many natural attractions, waterside shopping and leisurely strolls along the Harborwalk, its culinary scene is just as enticing‚Äù said Wendie Vestfall, Punta Gorda/Englewood Beach Visitor and Convention Bureau Tourism Director. ‚ÄúWe are urging Charlotte County residents and friends to cast a vote daily to help our beloved town win a USA TODAY 10Best Readers‚Äô Choice Award.‚Äù Punta Gorda is the only Florida nominated town among 19 other nominees across the country. Voting is limited to one vote per person, per day and winners will be announced on the USA TODAY 10Best website on Friday,¬†July 10. Information on Punta Gorda/Englewood Beach is available at PureFlorida.com. Engage with the destination on social media at @RealPureFlorida on Facebook, Instagram and Twitter. ABOUT PUNTA GORDA/ENGLEWOOD BEACH Located on Florida‚Äôs coveted Southwest Gulf Coast, halfway between Tampa and Naples, Punta Gorda/Englewood Beach is a charming collection of coastal communities surrounding the state‚Äôs second largest harbor. Florida‚Äôs premier year-round eco-tourism destination, the area offers pristine, unspoiled beauty. A haven for outdoor enthusiasts, Punta Gorda/Englewood Beach showcases a variety of vibrant experiences. From beaches to boating, hiking to harbor tours, fishing to nature discovery; to sun, shelling and fossilized sharks teeth, the destination celebrates the active traveler and lively local in search of relaxation and unlimited discovery. Most notably known for its 830 miles of pristine unparalleled shoreline, including captivating river passages, a mangrove-edged aquatic preserve and more than a dozen miles of natural Gulf beaches, the Charlotte Harbor Gulf Island Coast includes the areas of Boca Grande, Don Pedro Island, El Jobean, Englewood-Cape Haze, Little Gasparilla Island, Manasota Key, Knight Island, Placida, Babcock Ranch, Port Charlotte and Punta Gorda. To learn more about Punta Gorda/Englewood Beach, visit http://PureFlorida.com or call 1-800-652-6090 or engage with the destination on Instagram, Twitter and Facebook @RealPureFlorida. ABOUT 10BEST.COM 10Best.com provides users with original, unbiased, and experiential travel content of top attractions, things to see and do, and restaurants for top destinations in the U.S. and around the world. The core of the site's uniqueness is its team of local travel experts: a well-traveled and well-educated group who are not only experts in their fields - and their cities - but discriminating in their tastes. These local experts live in the city they write about so the content is constantly updated. 10Best.com averages 5 million visitors per month. It was acquired by USA TODAY in January of 2013. ABOUT USA TODAY USA TODAY is a multi-platform news and information media company. Founded in 1982, USA TODAY's mission is to serve as a forum for better understanding and unity to help make the USA truly one nation. Through its unique visual storytelling, USA TODAY delivers high-quality and engaging content across print, digital, social and video platforms. An innovator of news and information, USA TODAY reflects the pulse of the nation and serves as the host of the American conversation ‚Äî today, tomorrow and for decades to follow. USA TODAY, the nation's number one newspaper in print circulation with an average of more than 1.6 million daily, and USATODAY.com, an award-winning newspaper website launched in 1995, reach a combined 6.6 million readers daily. USA TODAY is a leader in mobile applications with more than 16 million downloads on mobile devices. USA TODAY is owned by Gannett Co., Inc. (NYSE: GCI). Trail, Suite G-2 Port Charlotte, FL 33948 Phone: (941) 743-1900 E-mail: Visit@PureFlorida.com The Punta Gorda/Englewood Beach Visitor & Convention Bureau's (VCB) role is to increase awareness of Charlotte County area domestically and internationally. Marketing strategies are targeted to encourage leisure and business travel, including individuals, families, group tours, meetings and conferences, weddings, reunions, sports competitions, special events and film projects. The Bureau's¬†efforts generate revenue for resorts, hotels, condominiums and home rentals, as well as restaurants, retailers, attractions, recreational activities and supporting service companies. Marketing & Communications The Visitor & Convention Bureau's marketing efforts are designed to build top-of-mind awareness for the destination,¬†develop a strong brand identity for the area, and create a unified presence in the marketplace through¬†marketing initiatives that target specific travelers through multiple online and offline opportunities.¬†Some of the marketing department's¬†strategies include quarterly and annual research studies, production for¬†an annual¬†Visitor¬†Guide and all sales collateral and brochures to support our activities. We also are responsible for developing and implementing the annual media plan that includes digital and print advertising for multiple audiences. We manage the websites and support functions, manage¬†the customer relationship management (CRM) system, and manage all email communications to Partners and the public audiences. Sports¬†& Events The Bureau's focus on sports utilizes sports as a vehicle to diversify Charlotte County's tourism appeal on a year-round basis. A number of high-quality sporting venues, combined with a picturesque natural destination and warm hospitality, allow the VCB to attract state, regional, national and international sporting events which contribute significantly to increased economic impact. Meetings & Conventions Professional sales staff promotes the Punta/Gorda/Englewood Beach, the Charlotte Harbor Gulf Island Coast¬†as a group travel destination to consumers, travel agents, tour operators and small meeting and conference planners. The Bureau also participates in a series of carefully selected travel, trade, and consumer shows in key markets to meet with travel agents, tour operators, event organizers and meeting planners who sell the destination. Public Relations The public relations effort is designed to facilitate media awareness by building and strengthening relationships with travel editors, writers and other journalistic resources. The resulting articles and editorial coverage by travel media featuring Charlotte County's tourism opportunities provide exposure which the Bureau's advertising budget cannot otherwise support. The value of this publicity is further enhanced by professional travel writers' validations of Punta Gorda/Englewood Beach as a premier vacation destination. Film Development The Film staff promotes Charlotte County¬†as a filming location by responding to leads and developing relationships with location scouts in the production industry. Film projects generate significant expenditures and destination awareness. The Bureau works to attract projects within the industry that include films, television, commercials, documentaries, catalog shoots, music videos and digital media/interactive entertainment. Advocacy By showcasing the¬†natural beauty and vibrant community of Punta Gorda, Port Charlotte,¬†and Englewood Beach, the VCB helps shape a positive perception of our county. When people think of Florida‚Äôs Gulf Coast, they think of welcoming local businesses, the beautiful surroundings, and the hospitality that makes Charlotte County a destination of choice. Learn more about how we advocate for our beautiful county here . Retta Esplanade Punta Gorda,  FL,  US 33950 Visit website King Fisher Fleet Recreation King Fisher Fleet, based out of Fishermen's Village in Punta Gorda offers the best of Florida - both for sightseers and for fishermen. Sightseeing cruises to Cabbage Key or Cayo Costa, eco-tours up the Peace River, full and half day cruises, sunset cruises and harbor tours will keep your camera clicking at dolphins and other wildlife.

Fishermen will be thrilled to discover the variety of fish inhabiting the 2nd largest estuary in the State of Florida, frequently referred to as the Tarpon Fishing Capital of the World.  Anglers can choose between deep sea charter fishing in the Gulf of Mexico or back bay fishing in the Charlotte Harbor Aquatic Preserve. 1200 W. Retta Esplanade Punta Gorda,  FL,  US 33950 Visit website Babcock Ranch Eco Tours Recreation Enjoy a 90-minute eco tour through 4 distinctive environments right here in Charlotte County.  Babcock Ranch and Telegraph Cypress Swamp. Experienced guides offer in-depth descriptions of birds, animals, plants, and the cattle and horses that are raised on the ranch. Visitors will see alligators, and many other animals living in Southwest Florida.

In the tour area you'll find a small museum featuring Florida history, Babcock operations, and natural history artifacts. The museum itself is actually a movie set used by Warner Brothers in the 1995 film "Just Cause" (starring Sean Connery) that was filmed in part right here on Babcock Ranch.

Our gift shop features items of special interest to Babcock Ranch, the Eco Tour and Florida wildlife. The "Country Store" is open before and after tour times.

Picnic Facilities are available year-round. & Convention Bureau on May. 01, 2024 Punta Gorda/Englewood Beach: The Ultimate Golf Destination Punta Gorda/Englewood Beach, FL ‚Äì May 1, 2024 ‚Äì Nestled along the stunning Charlotte Harbor Gulf Island Coast, Punta Gorda/Englewood Beach invites golfers from around the world to experience the pinnacle of the sport in Southwest Florida. With a backdrop of clear blue skies, sunny days and award-winning courses, this destination promises an unforgettable golfing getaway year-round. Golf Digest ranked the greater Punta Gorda area the third best places in America to live and golf. Golf aficionados will be delighted to discover over 20 exquisite golf courses throughout the region, each oQering a unique and picturesque setting for play. Whether you prefer a full round, practice session, or refining your skills with lessons, there's something for every golfer's preference and skill level. A few of the top golf courses in Punta Gorda/Englewood Beach include: Heritage Landing Golf & Country Club was remastered in 2019 by renowned Architect Gordon G. Lewis. Mr. Lewis reimagined the original concept and focused his knowledge and expertise on a new 18-hole layout, reshaping bunkers, redirecting the routing, and providing more visual aesthetics while improving friendlier playability for Heritage Landing. The course was recognized as the #2 golf course in the state of Florida in the "Top 50 U.S. Public Golf Courses-Golfers Choice" by Golf Pass, ranked by player reviews and #11 in the country. Riverwood Golf Club is consistently rated in the Top 50 courses in the US and in Florida. Riverwood features truly unique design features, natural beauty, and varying challenges. Riverwood is a Par 72 Championship golf course with a full-length practice range, multifaceted short game practice area, and putting green. The front nine flows through heavily wooded terrain, rich in stands of natural pine. The back nine meanders through saltmarsh and wetlands. Aileron Golf Club , formerly Kingsway Golf & Country Club is a newly redesigned golf course owned by the new Sunseeker Resort Charlotte Harbor and is exclusive to resort guests. Renowned golf architect Kipp Schulties, who has designed more than 50+ championship level golf courses in the state, led the renovation and is known for his work on Boca Raton Resort & Club and Quail Lodge Resort & Club. Aileron Golf Club made its fully reimagined debut in December of 2023, oQering a brand new 10,800 square foot clubhouse, restaurant, bar, and pro shop. The course, which features 17 water holes, delivers the ultimate resort-level golf experience. Additionally, Aileron Golf Club has earned accolades as one of the "Best Courses to Play in Southwest Florida" by PGA of America. Babcock National Golf Club features an 18-hole course layout that provides a unique golfing experience. They have multiple tee lengths to cater to players of all ages and skill levels. Designed by Gordon Lewis be prepared to play through idyllic scenery, pristine fairways, and strategically placed. ABOUT PUNTA GORDA / ENGLEWOOD BEACH Punta Gorda/Englewood Beach is Florida‚Äôs best-kept secret of a charming natural paradise located on the idyllic Southwest Gulf Coast. This coastal community surrounding the state‚Äôs second-largest harbor sits conveniently between Tampa and Naples. Outdoor enthusiasts will find a haven of vibrant experiences in the sun-soaked oasis of the Southwest Florida islands, characterized by almost year-round sunshine and sub-tropical weather. Relaxation and discovery await in miles of waterways and inland exploration trails filled with unspoiled natural beauty. From beaches to boating, hiking to harbor tours, fishing to nature paths; to sun, shelling, and fossilized sharks‚Äô teeth, Punta Gorda/Englewood Beach immerses lively locals and active adventurers in a pure island experience. Most notably known for its 830 miles of pristine unparalleled shoreline, including captivating river passages, a mangrove-edged aquatic preserve, and more than a dozen miles of natural Gulf beaches, the Charlotte Harbor Gulf Island Coast includes the areas of Boca Grande, Don Pedro Island, Englewood-Cape Haze, Little Gasparilla Island, Manasota Key, Knight Island, Placida, Babcock Ranch, Port Charlotte, Charlotte Harbor and Punta Gorda. To learn more about Punta Gorda /Englewood Beach, visit PureFlorida.com , call 941.743.1900 or discover the destination on Instagram, Twitter and Facebook @RealPureFlorida. Visitor & Convention Bureau on Feb. 18, 2022 Punta Gorda/Englewood Beach, Fla. (Feb. 8, 2022) ‚Äì The Association of Pickleball Professionals (APP) tournament returns on Feb. 23-27 at the PicklePlex in Punta Gorda at Florida Southwestern State College. After the huge success in 2020 & 2021, Punta Gorda/Englewood Beach Visitor & Convention Bureau is proud to welcome and support the return of the APP ‚Äì Punta Gorda Open for the next three years. ‚ÄúWe are excited to be the host destination through 2024 since it has been so valuable for our industry partners. The tournament created an economic impact of over $1 million with top professional athletes traveling as far away as Afghanistan, Canada, the United Kingdom, Japan, and Zimbabwe. In 2021 they produced over 1 million live streaming views in 50 different countries with over 26,000 social media engagements.¬† This strong partnership allowed us to become engaged with a completely different audience, which adds so much value to our industry partners and destination,‚Äù said Sean Walter, Business Development Director of Sports for the Punta Gorda/Englewood Beach Visitor & Convention Bureau. APP is the first USA Pickleball sanctioned tour for both professionals and amateurs in America and Europe. This event, having over 600 of the top amateur and professional players from across America, will compete for $40,000 in total prize money at the PicklePlex. Pickleball players compete in pro, senior pro, and amateur divisions. All individual matches will be played on one central court, giving spectators a close-up view to watch all the best professional players compete in their matches. There are 32 APP tournaments scheduled throughout the world to allow all player athletes, professionals, and amateurs to qualify for the season-ending championship, The APP Masters. ‚ÄúThe APP Tour has a special place in its heart for the team at PicklePlex and this beautiful destination,‚Äù said the CEO & Creative Founder of APP, Ken Herrmann.‚Äù They have been so supportive of the tour since its beginning and is a ‚Äúplayer and pro‚Äù favorite location on the tour stop. We can‚Äôt wait to come back in February.‚Äù Tickets are available for purchase, online at APP Tour Tickets . Tickets are also available for cash purchase at the gate. A grounds pass gets you entry into the pickleball venue at Pickleplex for each day that you have a valid ticket: Friday: Pro Mixed doubles, Saturday: Pro Gender Doubles, and Sunday: Pro Singles. Players registered to play do not need to purchase a grounds pass on the days that they are participating.¬† All registered players are allowed to bring a guest each day while they are playing.¬† Kids under 18 are free. If you have questions about the APP tournament, e-mail Ken Herrmann at Ken@APPTour.org . For Media Inquiries, e-mail Gloria Reilly at Gloria.Reilly@pickleplex.org. Sports The Punta Gorda/Englewood Beach Visitor & Convention Bureau (VCB) Sports Development Division is committed to the recruitment and development of youth, amateur, collegiate, interscholastic, and professional sports events, tournaments, training, and conventions. We invite you to explore the many sporting event venues we have to offer you and your clients. We stand ready to assist you and your team in planning a successful and memorable event that provides a long-lasting relationship for all involved. Our staff and venues focus on exceptional customer service that will enhance the experience for your athletes, coaches and fans and keep them coming back. Off the field, court or pool, our destination offers a variety of assets that will create memorable experiences year after year. EVENT SERVICES Complimentary Services Consult with you to discuss the logistical feasibility of finding the proper venue, financial services available, and local league support. Find the proper venue to support your overall goals Contact accommodations for host site, pricing, and room block and meeting room availability. Assist with event coordination, providing input on local rental and transportation companies, restaurants, attractions, etc. Forward press releases to our local and regional media outlets. Promote the event through our social media channels and calendar web site. Sports Sponsorship The intent of this sponsorship program is to facilitate and foster the growth of sporting events in Charlotte County and increase visitation, overnight stays, and patronage to restaurants and attractions in our destination, ultimately generating an economic impact for the County from out-of-county and out-of-state visitors.
